2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description:
It's part 1 of the 2-part Doom Patrol vs. Secret Six rematch you've all been waiting for! (Well, some of you. Well, Robotman seemed pretty heated up about it, anyway…) The battle starts here, and then continues over in DOOM PATROL #19!

Two Weeks ago- Eric Fine's stepfather Kevin has given him twenty-four house to be out of his house. This would mean the 21 year old might have to sleep on the streets, if not for a package from his deceased grandfather, which contains a DVD explaining how he was now willing Eric a particle cannon, four mistresses and three billion dollars.

Twelve days ago- Kevin comes home to Eric sitting in the dark. After Eric's gloating, he shoots his stepfather dead.

One week ago- Kevin shows up to his friends basement during one of their weekly D&D games. He explains that he is now starting a super villain organization called C.R.U.S.H. and their first order of business is to a build a base in the volcano on Oolong Island.

Twelve hours ago- Scandal Savage and Liana Kerzner try to set Bane up on a date with Spencer, a girl at Superiors Gentleman's Club, but Bane nearly kills a man and the three need to leave quickly. But not before Spencer asks Bane for a second date.

Now- Robotman is fishing in a stream on Oolong Island when he is surrounded by his Doom Patrol teammates. He explains he is there trying to catch one of the Chief's bio-accidents. But the team is ambushed by the Secret Six, who were hired by Eric, to kill the Doom Patrol so he could take over the island.

While the two teams are fighting Eric sends in his team to set a bomb in the volcano and when it blows it look like the end of the Doom Patrol and the Secret Six.
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Suicide Roulette, Part One of Two: Like a Star on the Horizon

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: THE ORIGINAL RED HULK ARTIST RETURNS!!! Ed McGuiness draws a special (and especially insane) issue of HULK! A classic Hulk enemy returns, and can only be defeated by...THE COMPOUND HULK! Guest-starring XEMNU, THE IMPOSSIBLE MAN and WOODGOD (yes, Woodgod)!
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Marvel Two in One; Save The Date Part One

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: The “Enemy Within” story arc continues! Our focus turns at last to Golden Voice — renowned Sun-Singer and holy man, turned violent revolutionary! Marcus’ decision to conscript Sunners into the city Watch forces Golden Voice’s hand, and even his own people aren’t sure about his new tactics. Can he bring them to freedom? Or is the rebellion doomed?
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: How To Be Dead

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: Miki and Hip spend a night in...
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Siren Song

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: This is it - the Final Issue of this award-winning series! Julie and Annie, sharing the same Alloy618-covered body, must fight their way through an army to stop the Phi Super-Collider from making a black hole that will consume Earth. Don't miss the adrenaline charged conclusion of Terry Moore's sci-fi thriller!
Translates Supergirl #43, 48-50 and Supergirl Annual #1.
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Supergirl: Der Tod Und Die Familie!

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: With his partner missing and himself held in the hands of the sadistic Doctor Orne, detective Ray Bierce must piece together the mystery that surrounds the beautiful Mrs. Hazera while blackmail, theft, and murder swirl all around. A supernatural twist on classic noir tales!
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: [Untitled]

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description:
The 30th issue of HorrorHound takes a special look at the history of horror in comic books with a special article written by Steve Niles. This is one of the most jam-packed comic-inspired issues to date featuring over 100 titles over the past 60 years.

Also included is a special retrospective on the Stephen King/George A. Romero film Creepshow. To top this off, we celebrate this landmark comic-themed issue with a PREVIEWS-exclusive cover, only available in comic shops!

  • Creepshow
  • Universal Monsters
  • Men's Magazines; Pulp Fiction History

Now that Negi has learned all about his parents and his village, Goedel invites the boy to join forces with him, promising to help Negi get revenge on those who destroyed his life. Our hero asserts that vengeance was never his goal, but the dark magic inside him claims otherwise.

Chapter Titles

  • 268th Period: Love and the Collapse of A World
  • 269th Period: To the End of the World
  • 270th Period: Choose!
  • 271st Period: Crisis! For the Mercenary Swordsman of Legend
  • 272nd Period: FINAL ANSWER
  • 273rd Period: I Believe in My Father and My Friends!!
  • 274th Period: Negi Party's Great Escape!!
  • 275th Period: Cosmo Entelekheia Revived!!
  • 276th Period:Your Friends Are Your Greatest Strength!
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Join the Dark Side

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: Near Death.

'Inside Job' Part Two: Scourge the 'Evil Sonic' is imprisoned in Zone Jail! He's going to need support to escape, but the mercenary gang of the Destructix aren't interested. Can Scourge delve into their dark pasts and find a reason to gain their trust? Or will he wind up a green smear on the wall?
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Inside Job, Part Two

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: Translates Detective Comics #861-865 and DC Universe Holiday Special.

FEAR ITSELF TIE-IN The New Mutants fight the scariest beings you never knew existed! The events of Fear Itself aren't confined to our reality so when strange forces take Hel over from its ruler Hela, it's up to Dani Moonstar to fulfill her role as Valkyrie and save the day. Her teammates are afraid of what will happen if Dani does this alone, but will they abandon the X-Men as Juggernaut destroys San Francisco?
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Fear Itself Tie-In

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: Translates Ms. Marvel #47 and The Amazing Spider-Man #627-629.

The finale of "On to Genesis!" In 1930s New York, Wilson Taylor confronts the true enormity of his betrayals, while in the present day, Tom comes face-to-face with their aftermath – and the link that binds him both to the Tinker and his creator.
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: On to Genesis, Conclusion

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description: This is the issue that IRREDEEMABLE fans have been waiting for since the very beginning. Where did the Plutonian truly come from, and where is his real home? Do his parents hold the key to stopping his mission of revenge on the world that turned their back on him? You can’t miss this epic issue of Mark Waid's multiple Eisner and Harvey Award-nominated superhero series!
Translates X-Men: Curse of the Mutants - Storm & Gambit, X-Men: Curse of the Mutants - Blade and X-Men: Curse of the Mutants - Smoke & Blood.

CHAOS part 4 brings events to a devastating head: Megatron confronts his most formidable opponent yet... The Autobots scramble to keep out of the way of the Decepti-god's unstoppable rampage -- and Optimus Prime faces off against Galvatron, in a battle where the fate of the whole planet rests on the outcome! CHAOS concludes here and TRANSFORMERS will never be the same again!
2011-01-01|2011-12-30.name: Chaos, Part 4: Genesis

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description:

2011-01-01|2011-12-30.description:
After Harry betrayed him, Spidey is Norman Osborn’s prisoner and Bullseye’s plaything! Can the wall-crawler survive long enough to rescue harry and Lily from Osborn’s clutches (or should he)?

Plus, shocking revelations!

Also, classic action in the mighty Marvel manner, as Pete and MJ find themselves homeless on Christmas Eve!

Includes material reprinted from Amazing Spider-Man #597-598 and Amazing Spider-Man #314! 76 pages!

Story Titles

  • Ausgetrickst
  • Ein hinterhältiger Finanzberater
  • Aufstand der Taler
  • Aus der Traum!
  • Lob der Sparsamkeit
  • Kostenlose Verköstigung
  • Einsamer Triumph
  • Gelernt ist eben gelernt
  • Ein Sturz mit Folgen
  • Einfach untrennbar
  • Gesetze und ihre Lücken
